awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award-Genetic Algorithms andMachine Learning in Dynamic Systems Control
awd_abstract_narration: A three-pronged research effort will be initiated.  Four projects in            three categories, genetic algorithms, classifier (rule-learning)                systems, and fluid pipeline simulation and control, will be undertaken.         The role of dominance operators in genetic algorithms will be studied           to demonstrate their importance in non-stationary environments;                 extensions to classifier systems will be studied to enhance their               rule-learning capability when applied to dynamic system control;                stochastic interpolations in time will be studied as a new numerical            solution technique for hyperbolic partial differential equations with           possible efficiency and accuracy advantages; and a pipeline operations          laboratory will be established at the University of Alabama with its            first project targeted at advanced pipeline simulation.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
